original_title: Sri Lanka shares close up, interest in banks
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The Colombo Stock Exchange closed up on Thursday, CSE data showed.
The All Share Price Index was up 0.53 percent, or 56.94 points, at 10,850.
The S&P SL20 index was up 1.07 percent, or 33.352 points, at 3,136.
Turnover was at 776 million. The banks sector contributed 199 million, and the transportation sector contributed 172 million of this.
Top positive contributors to the ASPI were Expolanka Holdings Plc (up at 149.25), Sampath Bank Plc (up at 73.40), and John Keells Holdings Plc (up at 192.00).
There was a net foreign inflow on 48 million. (Colombo/Dec11/2023).
